title: King & King
descriptions:
"King & King" is a children's book that tells the story of Prince Bertie, who is expected to marry a princess and take over the kingdom. However, the prince confesses to his mother, the Queen, that he has never cared much for princesses. In an attempt to find a suitable bride, the Queen brings in princesses from various countries, each with their own unique talents. However, none of them capture the prince's interest.

Just when it seems like all hope is lost, Princess Madeleine arrives at the castle with her brother Prince Lee. Both Prince Bertie and Prince Lee are immediately smitten with each other and decide to get married. The rejected princesses and their families attend the wedding, and the two princes are declared King and King. Finally, the Queen can relax and enjoy her retirement.

The book is illustrated using collages made of cut paper and mixed-media art. It ends with a heartwarming kiss between the two kings, promoting love and acceptance. "King & King" teaches children about different types of love and challenges traditional gender norms in a playful and engaging manner.

In the book "King & King," Prince Bertie is being pressured by his mother, the Queen, to find a princess to marry and take on the responsibility of ruling the kingdom. However, Bertie confesses that he has never been interested in princesses. The Queen brings in princesses from various places, all with unique talents, but none of them capture Bertie's attention. Meanwhile, Princess Madeleine and her brother Prince Lee arrive at the castle. Both Bertie and Lee are immediately drawn to each other and fall in love. They decide to get married, much to the surprise of everyone. The rejected princesses and their families attend the wedding, and Bertie and Lee are declared King and King. The Queen can finally relax, and the story ends with a kiss between the two kings. The book is illustrated with collages made of cut paper and mixed-media art.

"King & King" is a children's book that tells the story of Prince Bertie, a young prince who has not yet married, much to the frustration of his mother, the Queen. The Queen insists that Bertie must find a princess to marry so that he can take over the responsibility of ruling the kingdom. However, Bertie confesses to his mother that he has never cared much for princesses. Despite this, the Queen brings in princess after princess from various places, each with their own talents, in an attempt to find a suitable match for her son. However, none of the princesses capture Bertie's interest.

One day, Princess Madeleine arrives at the castle with her brother, Prince Lee. Both Bertie and Lee are immediately smitten with each other and fall in love. They decide to get married and preparations begin right away. The wedding is attended by all the rejected princesses and their families. During the ceremony, Bertie and Lee are declared King and King, and the Queen can finally relax and enjoy her retirement.

The book concludes with a sweet kiss between the two kings. The illustrations in the book are created using cut paper and mixed-media art, including ink and paint. "King & King" is a heartwarming tale that teaches children about love, acceptance, and the importance of following one's heart.

Just when it seems hopeless, Princess Madeleine arrives with her brother Prince Lee. Both Prince Bertie and Prince Lee immediately fall in love with each other and begin preparations for their wedding. The rejected princesses and their families attend the wedding, where the two princes are declared King and King. Finally, the Queen can relax and enjoy her retirement.

The book is illustrated using cut paper and mixed-media art, including ink and paint. It ends with a heartwarming kiss between the two kings, celebrating love and acceptance. "King & King" teaches children about love and challenges traditional gender roles, promoting inclusivity and diversity.

In an attempt to find a suitable princess for her son, the Queen parades numerous princesses from around the world through the castle. However, none of them capture Bertie's interest, despite their various talents. 

Everything changes when Princess Madeleine arrives, accompanied by her brother Prince Lee. Both Bertie and Lee are immediately drawn to each other and fall in love. The two princes begin preparations for their wedding, which is attended by all the rejected princesses and their families. In a joyful celebration, Bertie and Lee are declared King and King, and the Queen can finally relax. The story concludes with a tender kiss between the two kings.

The book is beautifully illustrated with collages made of cut paper and mixed-media art. The illustrations incorporate ink and paint, adding depth and visual interest to the story.

"King & King" is a heartwarming tale that challenges traditional notions of love and marriage, promoting acceptance and inclusivity. It teaches young readers about love and the importance of following one's heart, regardless of societal expectations.
generation_prompt_text:
Please write a summary of the following book. A sample summary is included below for reference. Use the sample as a guideline for quality and level of detail.

---

Title: King & King

Description: "On the tallest mountain above town," the young Prince Bertie still has not married, as is the custom in his kingdom. His mother, a grouchy Queen who is tired of ruling and wishes to pass on the responsibility to her son, insists he must find a princess to marry. The prince tells his mom "Very well, Mother.... I must say, though, I've never cared much for princesses." His mother marches princess after princess through the castle, from places ranging from Greenland to Mumbai, but in spite of their various talents — Princess Aria of Austria sings opera, Princess Dolly from Texas juggles and does magic tricks — they fail to interest the prince (though the prince's page falls in love with the princess from Greenland). After a while, along comes Princess Madeleine escorted by her brother Prince Lee. At the same time, both Bertie and Lee exclaim, "What a wonderful prince!" The princes immediately fall in love, and they begin marriage preparations at once. The wedding is attended by all the rejected princesses and their families; the two princes are declared King and King, and the Queen can finally relax, sunning herself in a lounge chair near the page and the princess from Greenland. The story ends with a kiss between the two kings. The illustrations are created as collages with cut paper and mixed-media art, including ink and paint.
